content.text: To ensure the long-term sustainability and operational efficiency of Eduversal Partner Schools through robust financial management, strategic resource allocation, and high standards of facility operations, all aimed at supporting the core mission of student learning.
Schools must adhere to strict financial controls and transparent reporting practices.

items.title: Annual Budgeting
points: The Principal and General Manager prepare an annual operating budget in consultation with department heads.
Budgets must align with the School Improvement Plan (SIP) priorities.
Final approval is required from the Foundation Board before the start of the fiscal year.

items.title: Tuition and Fee Management
points: Clear policies for tuition collection, late fees, and scholarships.
Digital payment systems are preferred to ensure traceability.
Scholarship funds (Eduversal Scholarship) are managed separately and audited.

items.title: Financial Reporting
points: Monthly financial statements (P&L, Cash Flow) submitted to the Board.
Annual external audit by a certified public accountant.

content.text: Strict controls are required for all cash handling to prevent fraud and error.

items: Petty Cash Limit: Maximum cash on hand is IDR 5,000,000. Replenishment requires submission of valid receipts.
Cash Collection: All cash received (uniform sales, events) must be receipted immediately and deposited to the bank within 24 hours.
Safe Access: Only the Finance Officer and GM hold keys/codes to the school safe. Access logs must be maintained.

content.text: A safe, clean, and inspiring physical environment is essential for learning.

content.title: Key Operational Standards
items: Preventive Maintenance: Monthly checks of HVAC, generators, and fire safety systems. Annual structural inspections.
Cleaning Protocols: Hourly toilet checks with sign-off sheets. Deep cleaning during term breaks.
Security: 24/7 security personnel, CCTV monitoring with 30-day retention, mandatory visitor ID badges.
Health & Safety Audits: Termly walkthroughs to identify hazards (loose cables, broken furniture, chemical storage).

content.text: Procurement processes must be fair, competitive, and transparent.

content.title: Procurement Thresholds (Example)
rows: Direct purchase with approval from HOD.
Three written quotes required; approval from GM.
Formal tender process; Board approval required.

content.text: Proper tracking of school property prevents loss and aids financial reporting.

items: Asset Register: All items > IDR 1,000,000 must be tagged with a unique barcode and logged in the digital asset register.
Stock Taking: Full physical inventory check conducted annually in June. Spot checks conducted quarterly.
Disposal: Broken or obsolete assets require a 'Disposal Form' signed by the GM before removal.
Indonesian Tax Laws and Foundation Regulations.
